study_plan_entry.title: Introduction to practical aspects of animal experimentation and animal facilities (Winter) (EDNE)

free_text.Learning outcomes: To acquire the practical skills with laboratory animals as requested by legislation (Swiss ordinance N° 455.171.2, October 1998) to get the accreditation to perform animal experimentation delivered by the Federal Veterinary Office. [br/]This course has to be completed by 20 hours of theory given twice a year at the CHUV (Cours romand de formation à l'expérimentation animale, http://www.unifr.ch/inph/cofor/mod1/cours.htm) to get the Swiss federal veterinary service recognition to undertake animal experiments. These additional 20 hours of theory are not bound to the NE-009 credit.
free_text.Content: Housing, biology and manipulation of laboratory rodents, anesthesia, pain assesment and analgesia, collecting biological samples and applying substances, animal health monitoring and hygiene rules in animal facilities
free_text.Keywords: Animal experimentation, in vivo, mouse, rat, rabbit, guinea pig, farm animals
free_text.Note: The above is the practical part of the course, the theoretical part is organized by the CHUV for which a registration through your EPFL Lab is mandatory.[br/]This course is taking place on February 5,6 & 8, 2013 (Feb.5 & 8:full-time//Feb.6: only afternoon)[br/]The attendance is limited to 16 participants[br/]Registration as usual to the EDNE admin. with cc to your thesis director[br/]Details on the planning and on the meeting place will be transmitted by the instructors, some days prior to the starting date.
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic biology and animal physiology of mammals. Priority is given to participants having to work with lab animals for their thesis.

en.title: Introduction to practical aspects of animal experimentation and animal facilities (Winter) (EDNE)
